channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports

item.title: GOW Week 11: Santa Fe Christian 28, Bishop's 9
item.description: GOW Week 11: Santa Fe Christian 28, Bishop's 9 Blue Hat Player of the Game Lincoln Mundis - Santa Fe Chrisitan RB
item.dc:creator: Fox 5

item.title: Blue Jays' Max Scherzer gets second World Series Game 7 start after Dodgers force winner-take-all
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Max Scherzer is about to become the only living pitcher to start two winner-take-all Game 7s in the World Series.
item.dc:creator: RONALD BLUM, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Double trouble: Barger gets caught off second base as Blue Jays' rally fizzles in Game 6 of Series
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Addison Barger was thinking base hit off the bat — and he was going to score the tying run for Toronto in the ninth inning Friday night. Then, in a flash, he got doubled off second and Game 6 was over. Just like that.
item.dc:creator: ROB GILLIES, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Jazz get burned by the Suns, 118-96
item.description: PHOENIX (ABC4 Sports) - The Utah Jazz fell in an early hole they could not climb out of in a 118-96 loss to the Phoenix Suns Friday night.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: New-look Dodgers lineup only produces 4 hits but they come at right time as LA forces Game 7
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — A new-look lineup for the Los Angeles Dodgers only produced four hits in Game 6, but three of them came in a three-run rally off Blue Jays starter Kevin Gausman.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Brian Kelly faces harsh criticism from LSU football staffers after dismissal
item.description: Brian Kelly’s tenure at LSU ended in disappointment, and staff members accuse the former coach of poor relationships and a failure to grasp team culture.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Police investigating break-in at home reported to belong to NBA star Shai Gilgeous-Alexander
item.description: Police on Friday were investigating a burglary at a home reported to belong to the Oklahoma City Thunder’s Shai Gilgeous-Alexander that happened while the NBA's reigning MVP was playing a game the night before.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Jaguars' Travis Hunter surprisingly lands on injured reserve; coach noncommittal about return for this season
item.description: Travis Hunter sustained a noncontact knee injury during practice this week, leaving head coach Liam Coen unsure whether he will return this season.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Quarterback Jayden Daniels will start for the Commanders against Seahawks on Sunday night
item.description: ASHBURN, Va. (AP) — Washington quarterback Jayden Daniels will start for the Commanders against the Seattle Seahawks on Sunday night. Daniels, hampered by an injured right hamstring, missed his third game of the season on Monday night when the Commanders fell 28-7 to the Kansas City Chiefs.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Chauncey Billups hires Trump's former attorney for federal gambling probe investigation
item.description: Los Angeles Clippers coach Chauncey Billups has hired Trump’s former lawyer to represent him in the case of alleged involvement in rigged poker games.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: LSU athletic director Scott Woodward ousted, 4 days after the firing of football coach Brian Kelly
item.description: LSU athletic director Scott Woodward resigned under pressure from the post he's held for six years on Thursday night, four days after the firing of football coach Brian Kelly and a day after Republican Gov. Jeff Landry said Woodward would not hire Kelly's replacement.
item.dc:creator: BRETT MARTEL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Matchup of powerhouse Chicagoland programs highlights 1st round of IHSA state football playoffs this weekend
item.description: In what surely has to be one of the most significant first-round matchups in IHSA state football playoff history, longtime rivals Chicago Mt. Carmel and Loyola Academy of Wilmette square off at 4:30 p.m. Saturday in the Class 8A bracket, which has the state's largest programs.
item.dc:creator: Michael Johnson, WGN 9

item.title: Grand Junction advances in Colorado boys' soccer state tournament
item.description: GRAND JUNCTION, Colo. (KREX) — Grand Junction beats Liberty 4-0 to advance past the first round of the state playoffs. The Tigers' soccer team keeps rolling after an undefeated season. The Tigers opened the scoring 1:08 into the first half.
item.dc:creator: Jackson Cowen, KREX 5

item.title: Snowbasin named #3 ski resort in the West
item.description: HUNTSVILLE, Utah (ABC4 Sports) - Snowbasin Resort has once again been recognized among North America’s best, earning the No. 3 spot in SKI Magazine’s “Top 30 Resorts in the West” for 2026.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: Mural honors Blue Jays catcher, Tijuana native Alejandro Kirk
item.description: "To see him reach this level of play in the world series, and not only that, but standing out in these games … truth is he will always be a source of pride more than anything for all of us," said Roberto, a Dodgers fan who finds himself rooting for Kirk.
item.dc:creator: Salvador Rivera, Fox 5

item.title: Markkanen scores 51 as Jazz beat Suns in overtime, 138-134
item.description: SALT LAKE CITY (ABC4 Sports) - Lauri Markkanen scored a career-high 51 points, the first Jazz player to reach 50 in the regular season since Karl Malone in 1998, and Utah beat the Phoenix Suns 138-134 in overtime on Monday night.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: SDFC wins playoff debut at Snapdragon Stadium, defeats Portland 2-1
item.description: San Diego FC defeated the Portland Timbers 2-1 in Game 1 of the best-of-three first-round series, becoming just the third expansion team in MLS history to win its first playoff game in its inaugural season.
item.dc:creator: Sharisse Cohee, Fox 5

item.title: Barstool Sports personality Cody 'Beef' Franke dies suddenly at 31
item.description: Popular Barstool Sports internet personality Cody "Beef" Franke has died at the age of 31 after suffering a "sudden medical issue over the weekend.
item.dc:creator: Zach Kaplan, NewsNation

item.title: Former NFL center Nick Mangold dies shortly after sharing he needed kidney transplant
item.description: His death comes less than two weeks after the two-time All-Pro selection announced on social media that he had kidney disease and needed a transplant.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: SDFC to host sellout crowd at Snapdragon for first-ever playoff match: How to watch
item.description: San Diego FC will host the Portland Timbers at Snapdragon Stadium on Sunday for Game 1 of Round 1 of the 2025 MLS Cup Playoffs, with tickets sold out and fans able to watch or listen from home or at local bars and restaurants.
item.dc:creator: Sharisse Cohee, Fox 5

item.title: Bulls beat the cold-shooting Magic 110-98 for a 2-0 start
item.description: ORLANDO, Fla. (AP) — Josh Giddey had 21 points and eight rebounds, and the Chicago Bulls beat the Orlando Magic 110-98 on Saturday night for a 2-0 start. Jalen Smith added 16 points for the Bulls, one of their four players off the bench in double figures.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: BYU keeps rolling with 41-27 win at Iowa State
item.description: AMES, Iowa (ABC4 Sports) - There was no letdown after the rivalry game this time. Bear Bachmeier threw for 307 yards and two touchdowns, both to Parker Kingston, as the 11th-ranked Cougars came from 14 points down to beat Iowa State Saturday afternoon, 41-27.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4
